instruction: Wash the seeraga samba rice under running water 2–3 times until the water runs clear.
title: Rinse the Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.400 Today, we are going to make a famous biryani from Tamil Nadu using a pressure cooker.

instruction: Soak the washed rice in water for 20–30 minutes. This helps it cook evenly and absorb flavors better.
title: Soak the Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.400 Today, we are going to make a famous biryani from Tamil Nadu using a pressure cooker.
00:00:05.400 --> 00:00:35.400 This biryani is a specialty at many famous restaurants in Tamil Nadu and is known for its unique flavor.

instruction: In a bowl, mix curd, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, black pepper powder, and salt.
title: Prepare Marinade

transcript_segments.text: 00:00:35.400 --> 00:01:05.400 First, we add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp Kashmiri chili powder, and a bit of salt to yogurt and mix well.

instruction: Add the mutton or chicken to the marinade and coat well. Let it rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
title: Marinate the Meat

transcript_segments.text: 00:01:05.400 --> 00:01:11.460 Then add ginger-garlic paste and marinate the chicken. Let it rest for a while.
00:01:11.460 --> 00:01:15.460 Now mix everything together thoroughly with the chicken.
00:01:15.460 --> 00:01:45.460 We’re going to make a special masala now. For that, we’ll use mint leaves, coriander leaves, onions, and green chilies.
00:01:45.460 --> 00:02:15.460 Grind the mixture well. Now we’ll cook this in a pressure cooker along with the marinated chicken and rice.

instruction: In a heavy-bottomed pot, heat the oil and optional ghee over medium heat.
title: Heat the Oil and Ghee

transcript_segments.text: 00:01:45.460 --> 00:02:15.460 Grind the mixture well. Now we’ll cook this in a pressure cooker along with the marinated chicken and rice.

instruction: Add fennel seeds, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and star anise. Fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds).
title: Fry Whole Spices

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:15.460 --> 00:02:26.400 Add some dry spices and chopped onions to enhance the flavor.

instruction: Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown, stirring occasionally.
title: Sauté the Onions

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:15.460 --> 00:02:26.400 Add some dry spices and chopped onions to enhance the flavor.
00:02:26.400 --> 00:02:31.220 Stir everything together to get a good mix.
00:02:31.220 --> 00:02:35.220 The aroma starts coming through as we sauté the onions.

instruction: Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Cook until the raw smell disappears (around 2–3 minutes).
title: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste and Chilies

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:31.220 --> 00:02:35.220 The aroma starts coming through as we sauté the onions.

instruction: Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate from the mixture.
title: Cook the Tomatoes

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:35.220 --> 00:02:39.220 Add tomatoes and cook until soft and blended.

instruction: Mix in mint leaves and coriander leaves. Cook for another 1–2 minutes until wilted and fragrant.
title: Add Fresh Herbs

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:35.220 --> 00:02:39.220 Add tomatoes and cook until soft and blended.

instruction: Transfer the marinated meat into the pot. Stir well to combine with the masala base.
title: Add Marinated Meat

transcript_segments.text: 00:02:39.220 --> 00:02:44.220 Now add the ground masala paste and stir it into the mixture.
00:02:44.220 --> 00:02:47.220 Let it cook well with the masala.
00:02:47.220 --> 00:02:50.220 Continue stirring until oil separates from the masala.
00:02:51.220 --> 00:02:54.220 Now add the marinated chicken into this mixture.
00:02:54.220 --> 00:02:59.020 Along with that, add freshly ground garam masala and sauté everything together.
00:02:59.020 --> 00:03:00.320 This is the biryani masala base.
00:03:00.320 --> 00:03:30.300 Add chili powder and garam masala. Mix it all well.

instruction: Cook the meat on medium heat until it's partially cooked and the masala is thick and clings to the meat.
title: Cook the Meat

transcript_segments.text: 00:03:30.300 --> 00:03:50.400 Once the masala is cooked, you’ll notice the oil rising. That’s when you know it’s ready.
00:03:50.400 --> 00:04:20.400 You can see the color and texture change, indicating it’s cooked properly.
00:04:20.400 --> 00:04:50.400 Add soaked rice and stir gently to combine it with the masala.

instruction: Add 3 1/2 cups of water to the pot. Stir and bring it to a boil over high heat.
title: Pour Water

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:20.400 --> 00:04:50.400 Add soaked rice and stir gently to combine it with the masala.

instruction: Taste and adjust salt as needed. The water should taste slightly salty at this stage.
title: Season the Water

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:50.400 --> 00:04:57.700 Now add 3 cups of water, adjust salt, and mix everything again.

instruction: Reduce the heat and simmer the meat for 5–10 minutes until it becomes tender.
title: Simmer the Meat

transcript_segments.text: 00:04:57.700 --> 00:05:27.700 Close the pressure cooker and cook for about 1 whistle on medium heat.
00:05:27.700 --> 00:05:57.700 Once done, allow the pressure to release naturally before opening the lid.

instruction: Drain the soaked rice completely and gently add it to the pot with the meat and broth.
title: Drain and Add Rice

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:57.700 --> 00:06:27.700 Fluff the rice gently. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the biryani has a rich aroma and flavor.

instruction: Stir the rice gently into the liquid, taking care not to break the grains.
title: Mix Gently

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:57.700 --> 00:06:27.700 Fluff the rice gently. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the biryani has a rich aroma and flavor.

instruction: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat for 15–20 minutes until the rice is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.
title: Cook on Dum

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:57.700 --> 00:06:27.700 Fluff the rice gently. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the biryani has a rich aroma and flavor.

instruction: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest, covered, for 10 minutes to allow flavors to settle.
title: Rest the Biryani

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:57.700 --> 00:06:27.700 Fluff the rice gently. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the biryani has a rich aroma and flavor.

instruction: Drizzle lemon juice over the cooked biryani. Gently fluff the rice to mix without breaking it.
title: Add Lemon Juice

transcript_segments.text: 00:05:57.700 --> 00:06:27.700 Fluff the rice gently. The chicken is cooked perfectly and the biryani has a rich aroma and flavor.

instruction: Serve hot with onion raita or brinjal gravy. Enjoy the distinct, spicy-tangy flavors of Dindigul biryani.
title: Serve

transcript_segments.text: 00:06:27.700 --> 00:06:54.970 Serve hot with raita or boiled eggs. Enjoy your delicious pressure cooker biryani!
